Overview

You can set up technical challenges by leveraging various question types such as Projects, Coding, and so on from the HackerRank platform.

You can set up real-world technical (Projects question-based) challenges by utilizing your existing company questions or by creating new questions on your own on the HackerRank platform.

Note: You will have access to only questions created by your organization. The HackerRank Library questions cannot be accessed.

Creating a Challenge for an Event

  1. On the Event page, click Challenge.You will be able to create or add questions from the My Company tab of the HackerRank platform.
  2. Click Create Question.You will be redirected to the Select Question Type page of the HackerRank platform.
  3. Select any question type and proceed with the wizard. Once you create the question, the question will be added to the Challenge on Engage.
  4. To add questions from your organization, click Questions.You will be redirected to the Questions tab of the HackerRank platform.
  5. Click on the plus icon to add questions from My Company.
  6. Here you can filter and add questions based on your requirements for the Challenge.
  7. Click on the plus icon against the question you want to add. The question is added.
  8. You will then need to Publish the Test. Once you publish the Test, the Challenge on the Engage platform is also updated.
  9. Finally, you can update the Challenge for plagiarism, proctoring, and other features provided by HackerRank.
  10. Click Settings on the Challenge page.
  11. You are then redirected to the Settings tab of the Test in HackerRank platform.
  12. Here you can edit the Test settings according to your requirement.
